PROJECTS.TITLE: DIGITAL GOVERNMENT AND OPEN DATA PLATFORM
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION: Design and implementation of a comprehensive digital government platform oriented towards transparency and data-based decision-making. The project integrates open data portals, strategic indicator dashboards, and public policy monitoring systems, allowing authorities and citizens to access reliable, updated, and actionable information to strengthen accountability and urban management.

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Smart City – Smart Communities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
GLACI Smart Cities, Smart Future accompanies the management and implementation processes of solutions based on ISO standards.

These allow objectively evaluating the development of sustainable cities and communities, through process standardization and with qualitative and quantitative analysis.
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT: The International Organization for Standardization, through its technical committee 268 for sustainable cities and communities, has developed the following Standards in this field of application.

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable development in communities - Management System for Sustainable Development
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
Its main goals are:

  • Build consensus on sustainable development
  • Improve sustainability, smartness, and resilience of all its actions
  • Develop cross-sectoral, multidisciplinary, life-cycle value, and total costing approaches.
  • Foster synergies
  • Increase efficiency and attractiveness of communities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
Scopes:

  • Applicable to communities of all sizes, structures, and types
  • Applicable to developed and developing countries
  • Applicable at local, regional, or national level
  • Applicable in urban or rural areas

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable development of communities – Indicators for city services and quality of life
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
This standard complements the series of indicators to measure performance in communities; it includes city services and quality of life in smart cities and resilient cities.

These indicators allow evaluation and in turn planning based on possible future needs and establishes as main goals:

  • Measurement of performance management of services and quality over time
  • Possibility of comparison to learn about performance measures
  • Policy development and priority setting
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
Scopes:

  • Aggregable indicators to very large administrative areas
  • Applicable to the evaluation of city resource efficiency
  • Together with other indicators, it allows a more integral and holistic approach to sustainability analysis

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable cities and communities - Indicators for Smart Cities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
It presents a benchmark for city sustainability, which requires additional indicators to those established to evaluate city services and quality of life. Together with the application of ISO 37120, it helps cities implement policies, programs, and projects for smart cities.

Scopes:

Together with ISO 37120, it aims to provide a complete set of indicators to measure progress towards a smart city.
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
Its goals are:

  • Apply collaborative leadership methods
  • Use data information and technologies to provide improvement in services and quality of life
  • Provide a better living environment from smart policies and making technologies available to citizens
  • Generate innovative solutions to environmental and sustainability issues
  • Identify needs and benefits of smart infrastructures
  • Facilitate innovation and growth
  • Build a dynamic and innovative economy that achieves resilience

CERTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Sustainable Cities and Communities – Indicators for Resilient Cities
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_LEFT:
A resilient city is capable of preparing, recovering, and adapting to shocks and stresses. This standard together with the indicators proposed in ISO 37120 allows the evaluation of Resilient Cities and also taking actions to manage and mitigate human and natural stress in relation to environmental degradation and economic instability that cause persistent negative impacts.

It presents specific indicators and also structured indicators according to a risk management and disaster management process; monitoring compliance with Sustainable Development Goals and structured in accordance with the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction, these aim to help cities:
CERTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION_RIGHT:
• Prepare, recover, and adapt to shocks and stresses
  • Generate learning based on comparison of performance measures and sharing good practices.


Scopes:

  • Applicable for measuring resilience in cities
  • Applicable to any city, municipality, or local government
  • Applicable regardless of its size or location
